member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID
member.summary: TheHTTP_HEADER_ID enumeration type lists known headers for HTTP requests and responses, and associates an array index with each such header. It is used to size and access the KnownHeaders array members of the and structures.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderCacheControl
member.summary: Used to specify caching behavior along the request or response chain, overriding the default caching algorithm.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderConnection
member.summary: Allows the sender to specify options that are desired for that particular connection. These are used for a single connection only and must not be communicated by proxies over further connections.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderDate
member.summary: The Date is a general header field that indicates the time that the request or response was sent.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderKeepAlive
member.summary: Based on the keepalive XML element (see RFC 2518, section 12.12.1, page 66); a list of URIs included in the KeepAlive header must be "live" after they are copied (moved) to the destination.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderPragma
member.summary: Used to include optional, implementation-specific directives that might apply to any recipient along the request/response chain.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderTrailer
member.summary: Indicates that specified header fields are present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderTransferEncoding
member.summary: Indicates what, if any, transformations have been applied to the message body in transit.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderUpgrade
member.summary: Allows the client to specify one or more other communication protocols it would prefer to use if the server can comply.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderVia
member.summary: The Via header field indicates the path taken by the request.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderWarning
member.summary: This is a response header that contains the 3-digit warn code along with the reason phrase.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAllow
member.summary: Lists the set of methods supported by the resource identified by the Request-URI.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentLength
member.summary: The size of the message body in decimal bytes.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentType
member.summary: The media type of the message body.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentEncoding
member.summary: The encoding scheme for the message body.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentLanguage
member.summary: Provides the natural language of the intended audience.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentLocation
member.summary: Location of the resource for the entity enclosed in the message when that entity is accessible from a location separate from the requested resource's URI.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentMd5
member.summary: An MD5 digest of the entity-body used to provide end-to-end message integrity check (MIC) of the entity-body.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderContentRange
member.summary: The content range header is sent with a partial entity body to specify where in the full entity body the partial body should be applied.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderExpires
member.summary: The date and time after which the message content expires.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderLastModified
member.summary: Indicates the date and time at which the origin server believes the variant was last modified.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAccept
member.summary: Used with the INVITE, OPTIONS, and REGISTER methods to indicate what media types are acceptable in the response.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAcceptCharset
member.summary: Indicates the character sets that are acceptable for the response.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAcceptEncoding
member.summary: The content encodings that are acceptable in the response.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAcceptLanguage
member.summary: Used by the client to indicate to the server which language it would prefer to receive reason phrases, session descriptions, or status responses.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAuthorization
member.summary: The user-agent can authenticate itself with a server by sending the Authorization request header field with the request. The field contains the credentials for the domain that the user is requesting.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderCookie
member.summary: The cookie request header contains data used to maintain client state with the server. Cookie data is obtained from a response sent with HttpHeaderSetCookie.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderExpect
member.summary: Indicates the specific server behaviors that are required by the client.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderFrom
member.summary: The From header field specifies the initiator of the SIP request or response message.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderHost
member.summary: Specifies the Internet host and port number of the requested resource. This is obtained from the original URI given by the user or referring resource.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderIfMatch
member.summary: The If-Match request header field is used with a method to make it conditional. A client that has one or more entities previously obtained from the resource can verify that one of those entities is current by including a list of their associated entity tags in the If-Match header field.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderIfModifiedSince
member.summary: The If-Modified-Since request header field is used with a method to make it conditional. If the requested variant has not been modified since the time specified in this field, an entity is not returned from the server; instead, a 304 (not modified) response is returned without any message-body.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderIfNoneMatch
member.summary: The If-None-Match request-header field is used with a method to make it conditional. When a client has obtained one or more entities from a resource, it can verify that none of those entities is current by including a list of their associated entity tags in the If-None-Match header field. The purpose of this feature is to allow efficient updates of cached information with a minimum amount of transaction overhead, and to prevent a method such as PUT from inadvertently modifying an existing resource when the client believes that the resource does not exist.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderIfRange
member.summary: If a client has a partial copy of an entity in its cache, and wishes to obtain an up-to-date copy of the entire entity, it can use the If-Range header. Informally, its meaning is, "if the entity is unchanged, send me the part(s) I am missing; otherwise, send me the entire new entity."

summary.para: The If-Unmodified-Since request-header field is used with a method to make it conditional. If the requested resource has not been modified since the time specified in this field, the server performs the requested operation as if the If-Unmodified-Since header were not present, but
if the requested resource has been modified, the server returns a 412 error (Precondition Failed).

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderMaxForwards
member.summary: The maximum number of proxies or gateways that can forward the request.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderProxyAuthorization
member.summary: This header field is used by the client to identify itself with a proxy.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderReferer
member.summary: Allows the client to specify, for the server's benefit, the address (URI) of the resource from which the Request-URI was obtained.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderRange
member.summary: Allows a client to request a part of an entity instead of the whole.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderTe
member.summary: This header field contains the recipient of the SIP request or response message.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderTranslate
member.summary: Allows the client to specify whether it wants the source representation or programmatic interpretation of the requested content.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderUserAgent
member.summary: Indicates what extension transfer-codings the client accepts in the response and whether or not the client accepts trailer fields in a chunked transfer-coding.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderRequestMaximum
member.summary: Not a value that actually designates a header; instead, it is used to count the enumerated Request headers.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAcceptRanges
member.summary: Allows the server to indicate its acceptance of range requests for a resource.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderAge
member.summary: Conveys the sender's estimate of the amount of time since the response (or its revalidation) was generated at the origin server.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderEtag
member.summary: Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderLocation
member.summary: Used to redirect the recipient to a location other than the Request-URI for completion of the request or identification of a new resource.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: The response field that must be included as a part of the 407 response. The field includes the authentication scheme and parameters that apply to the proxy for this Request-URI.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderRetryAfter
member.summary: The length of time that the service is expected to be unavailable to the requesting client.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderServer
member.summary: This is a response header field that contains information about the server that is handling the request.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderSetCookie
member.summary: The set-cookie response header contains data used to maintain client state in future requests sent with HttpHeaderCookie.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderVary
member.summary: Indicates the set of request header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderWwwAuthenticate
member.summary: The WWW_Authenticate header field contains the authentication schemes and parameters applicable to the Request-URI.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderResponseMaximum
member.summary: Not a value that actually designates a header; instead, it is used to count the enumerated Response headers.

member.name: HTTP_HEADER_ID.HttpHeaderMaximum
member.summary: Not a value that actually designates a header; instead, it is used to count all the enumerated headers.
